Schwarzeneggar Threatens to Slice College Budget

Friday, November 28th, 2008

FYI

http://media.www.lavalleystar.com/media/storage/paper295/news/2008/11/26/News/Schwarzenegger.Threatens.To.Slice.College.Budget-3562268.shtml\

“Should the mid-year budget proposal pass, California community colleges would be forced to turn away 262,845 students, according to Scott Lay, president and chief executive officer of the Community College League of California.”

Blog:

If state mid-year cuts are 5%, MSJC will need to cut 10% or use reserves funds.  These types of cuts are usually made on the backs of students through “enrollment management” efforts which cut available class sections impacting access.  It is highly unlikely that overcap FTES will be fully funded.

Selling ‘community’ to the world/PE

Friday, November 28th, 2008

http://www.pe.com/localnews/rivcounty/stories/PE_News_Local_S_international27.25d2aa3.html#

“Roger Schultz, superintendent/president of MSJC, said international students allow other students to experience cultures, values, foods and traditions from around the world without leaving the Inland area.”

“Since Schultz came to the college in 2001, international student enrollment has grown from fewer than 10 students to 54 this fall.  The college also has added a full-time clerk who tracks government regulations for international students and handles their application.”

Blog:

MSJC offers its own students international educational opportunities through partnerships with other community colleges for semester study abroad programs for those students interested.

Share This

Posted in News | Comments Off

Subterfuge

Tuesday, November 25th, 2008

FYI

Per the S/P, regarding a PD claim, the district “denied the claim” at the November BOT meeting.  A claim which according to Government Code 945.4 should have been on the open agenda and was not.

However, per the district’s PIO statement issued November 21st, no claim has actually been filed.

“Presently, the District has not been named as a defendant in any tort claim or lawsuit regarding matters involving the police department, nor has any complaint regarding the police department or its officers actually been filed.”

Blog:

May-be Board Chair Sparkman can explain the two contrary answers.  The vote by the BOT contradicts the PIO statement.  Will there be a correction?

Share This

Posted in News | 8 Comments »

District response/Public Information Officer

Friday, November 21st, 2008

“The District is performing a full investigation per direction of the Board of Trustees. The District has been advised by legal counsel that the District must and will respond, as legally required, to any formal complaints and tort claims. Presently, the District has not been named as a defendant in any tort claim or lawsuit regarding matters involving the police department, nor has any complaint regarding the police department or its officers actually been filed.”

Forward all inquiries to Karin Marriott, Mt. San Jacinto College Director of Marketing and Public Information, at 951-487-3060.

November 18, 2008

Blog:  Based on this communication, “the District has not been named as a defendant in any tort claim or lawsuit”.   Why did the BOT report out a vote, if not named as a defendant?

Hopefully the S/P knows.

Share This

Posted in News | No Comments »

Valley News/MSJC PD

Friday, November 21st, 2008

http://www.myvalleynews.com/story.php?story_id=34207

“According to a Riverside County Government tort claim, three MSJC police officers claim they were forced to quit under pressure for threatening to expose corruption in the department.”

“After filing the court claim last month, the three officers expect the county to respond within the next two weeks.”

“The college’s board of trustees rejected the demands in the tort claim on Nov.13.”  Karen Marriott, MSJC spokesperson

Blog:

Why would the MSJC Board of Trustees vote to reject demands in a tort claim against Riverside County?  The college PD is under jurisdiction of the college, not Riverside County?
